data.title: Dynamic Sports Training
data.meta_description: DST WEST Contact: west@dynamicsportstraining.com Lee Fiocchi, CSCS Lee is the Founder and an Owner of Dynamic Sports Training. He served as Head S&C Coach for the Los Angeles Angels from 2017-2021. He has been featured on ESPN as well as in USA Today, the LA Times, Houston Chronicle, and The Boston Globe. Lee played football
data.text:
DST WEST

Contact: west@dynamicsportstraining.com

Lee Fiocchi, CSCS

Lee is the Founder and an Owner of Dynamic Sports Training. He served as Head S&C Coach for the Los Angeles Angels from 2017-2021. He has been featured on ESPN as well as in USA Today, the LA Times, Houston Chronicle, and The Boston Globe. Lee played football at the collegiate level. There, he discovered his desire to help athletes reach their goals. He founded DST in 2008 with the vision to challenge every individual athlete’s genetic potential in their sport(s).

Contact: lee@dynamicsportstraining.com

Hayden Letts, CSCS, RSCC

Hayden is the Director of Operations at DST West and a Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist through the NSCA. Originally from Danville, CA, Hayden interned at DST North in the summer of 2018, was hired in October 2018, and currently leads DST West’s pro baseball off-season training.

Contact: hayden@dynamicsportstraining.com

Noah Brogdon, CPT

Noah is the Manager of High School & Youth Training at DST West. Prior to this role, Noah was a performance intern for us at DST San Antonio. Noah received his undergraduate degree in Sports Management with a minor in Psychology from Texas A&M where he also became a Certified Personal Trainer while coaching HIIT-style workouts.

Contact: noah@dynamicsportstraining.com

Maddy Olson, CPT

Maddy Olson is a Sports Performance Specialist and NFPT – Certified Personal Trainer at DST West. Originally from La Mirada, CA, Maddy played Division I Soccer at Sam Houston State University before joining DST in August 2022. She privately coaches a wide range of athletes at different ages and levels of experience, and also leads DST West’s adult fitness training.

Contact: maddy@dynamicsportstraining.com

Mackenzie Anderson, CPT, CNC

Mackenzie Anderson is a Sports Performance Specialist and NASM – Certified Nutrition Coach at DST West. Mackenzie facilitates our strength and conditioning partnership with Duchesne Academy and privately trains clients at DST West. Originally from Rosemount, MN, Mackenzie joined DST in the winter of 2023. Prior to that, Mackenzie attended the University of South Dakota, where she majored in kinesiology sports management, with an emphasis in exercise science, and minored in psychology and health.

Contact: mackenzie@dynamicsportstraining.com

Paul Yost, MS, CSCS PN1

Prior to joining DST, Paul has worked in various roles in the fitness and sports performance industry. This includes work at private facilities, work at the collegiate level at Texas A&M and in professional baseball as a part of the Cincinnati Reds, Seattle Mariners and the Toronto Blue Jays organizations. Having experience with athletes and clients from various sports and backgrounds has helped him become a more well-rounded coach and allows him to deliver better results for his clients.

Contact: paul@dynamicsportstraining.com

DST NORTH

Contact: north@dynamicsportstraining.com

Kevin Poppe, CSCS, RSCC*D, FRSC

Kevin is an Owner of DST as well as Director of Operations at DST North. He has been featured on MLB Network as well as in ESPN Magazine, The Athletic and The Houston Chronicle for his work with many of the top athletes in the country. Poppe played and coached baseball at Concordia University in Nebraska. Poppe is Rapsodo Pitching Certified and a member of the Diamond Kinetics Hitting Council.

Contact: kevin@dynamicsportstraining.com

Jason McCormack, MS, CSCS

Jason joined DST in 2021. He is the After School Group Manager and is a Certified Strength & Conditioning Specialist through the NSCA. Jason is a former DST Athlete who played baseball at Southwestern University where he received his BS in Kinesiology. He earned his MS in Kinesiology degree from Texas A&M University-Corpus Christi. While at TAMUCC, he was a graduate teaching assistant, instructing Physiology of Exercise and Biomechanics laboratory sections.

Contact: jason@dynamicsportstraining.com

Charlie Galloway, ACSM- EP-C

Charlie joined DST in 2020, and he is the Manager of Premier High School Groups. Galloway graduated from the University of Houston in 2020 with a degree in Kinesiology and an emphasis in Sports and Fitness, and he is a Certified Exercise Physiologist through the American College of Sports Medicine.

Contact: charlie@dynamicsportstraining.com

Jordan Ainsworth, NASM-CPT

Jordan is our Off-Site Trainer at DST. He has a CPT certification through ACSM. Prior to working at DST, Jordan played basketball at the collegiate level and coached at the high school level. He received a Bachelor’s of Science degree in Kinesiology from Mississippi College. Since joining DST, Jordan has become an expert at prepubescent development and become proficient in training athletes of all ages and all levels. His knowledge and experience continually prepare our athletes for the next level.

Contact: jordan@dynamicsportstraining.com

Kyle Kleeman, NFPT-CPT

Kyle is in charge of our NFL Draft Prep and Pro Football Off-Season training at DST West, and runs private speed training at DST North. Prior to working at DST, Kyle played collegiate football and won a national championship at Northwest Missouri State University. Kyle earned a Bachelor’s degree in Corporate Recreation & Wellness and is NFPT certified.

Contact: kyle@dynamicsportstraining.com

Kevin Williams, CSCS

Kevin Williams is a sports performance specialist at DST North. Originally from Angleton, TX, Kevin played baseball for Tyler Junior College and LSU Shreveport. He graduated from LSU Shreveport in 2016 with a B.S. in Community Health with a concentration of physical activity. After college Kevin pitched professionally for one year with the Tampa Bay Rays organization in the Gulf Coast League. Kevin began his internship with DST in September of 2017, officially hired as staff in February of 2018. He has experience working with athletes of all ages and levels, from youth to our professional athletes.

Contact: kwilliams@dynamicsportstraining.com

Haley Chapa

Haley is the Business Associate and an Assistant Coach at DST North. Haley received her undergrad at Sam Houston State University in Hunstville, TX.

Contact: haley@dynamicsportstraining.com

Chris Sampson, NASM-CPT

Chris Sampson is a Performance Coach and Client Relations Representative for DST and operated out of DST North. Sampson played several years in MLB as a starting pitcher for the Houston Astros. Sampson has coaching experience at the youth, high school and collegiate levels. All three of his sons are current DST athletes.

Contact: chris@dynamicsportstraining.com

DST SOUTH

Contact: south@dynamicsportstraining.com

Sammy Knox, NSCA-CSCS; FMS Professional Level 1 & 2

Sammy is the Director of Operations at DST South as well as a member of the Houston Astros organization as a Strength and Conditioning Coach. Sammy is a Certified strength & conditioning coach through the NSCA and Sports Performance Specialist at our DST South location (coming April 2018). Sammy received his Bachelors of Science degree in Kinesiology from the University of Houston and has been training athletes since 2011. As an athlete, Sammy played baseball at Cisco junior college and has a background in powerlifting. His passion is to guide athletes on how to get the most out of their given abilities.

Contact: sammy@dynamicsportstraining.com

Ryan Henry, CPT

Ryan Henry is a Business Operations Associate, Coach and seasonal Director of Operations at DST South. He received a bachelor of arts degree in multidisciplinary studies with focuses in business, communications, and math, graduating in December of 2016 from the University of Texas in San Antonio. He was president of the club baseball team for three years where he managed, coached, and played. He was named pitcher of the month in May of 2012 where he led his conference in strikeouts and ERA. He joined the DST team in 2017.

Contact: ryan@dynamicsportstraining.com

DST ARIZONA

Contact: arizona@dynamicsportstraining.com

Rick Gannon III, M.S., CSCS

Rick is the Director of Athletic Performance at DST Arizona / Arizona Christian University. He works with ACU’s: Football, Swim, Cross Country, Softball, Wrestling, Mens Basketball, and Beach Volleyball teams. Rick Runs the Pro-baseball off Season group. Before DST Rick interned at NAU, William Penn, Abilene Christian, and completed his graduate assistantship at Hardin Simmons University. His passion is helping athletes and military improve their performance through training. Rick lives in Phoenix Arizona with his Wife Kayla and son RJ IV.

Contact: rick@dynamicsportstraining.com

Jamie Balevic, NASM-CPT

Jamie Balevic is a sports performance specialist and hitting coach at DST Arizona. He works in the weight room and cages with the youth athletes, as well as ACU’s Baseball, Mens Volleyball, & Womens Volleyball teams. Prior to joining DST in August of 2019, Jamie played college ball at Wayland Baptist University where he received his BBA, interned at True Grind Systems under hitting coach Scott Lacey, and was a baseball coach for Arizona Christian University. His favorite part of training is helping athletes transfer their new strength and speed to the field.

Contact: jamie@dynamicsportstraining.com

MATTHEW BURHOP, NASM-CPT, CES,

Matt was born and raised in Phoenix Arizona. He loved playing sports from an early age and finished his playing career as a Lacrosse player which lead him into coaching. He coached lacrosse for Pinnacle High School and is also an assistant coach for the ACU team. Matt married his wife Raquel last year. He loves to stay active in his free time with pick up basketball, softball, and golfing. Matt Works with ACU’s football, Lacrosse, M/W Soccer, M/W golf, Stunt, Cheer and Dance, and Track and field teams.

Contact: matthew@dynamicsportstraining.com

Michael Romero

Michael Romero was born and raised in Tucson, Az. He moved to

Phoenix in 2011 where he coached AAU basketball for ten years.

Michael met his wife in 2012. He is a certified personal trainer,

performance enhancement coach, and strength and conditioning

coach. Michael works with ACU’s mens and women’s tennis, Beach Volleyball, and

women’s basketball teams. Mike also works with the afterschool group and runs the youth training camps for DST Arizona.

Contact: mike@dynamicsportstraining.com

DST PHOENIX CHRISTIAN

Ray Karvis, MSEd, CSCS

Coach Ray Karvis is the Associate Director of Athletic Performance at DST Arizona / Arizona Christian University. Ray joined the DST Arizona as an assistant strength coach in September of 2019 and serves as the assistant director of sports performance. He brings over twenty years of experience as an S&C coach to the team. Coach K recently completed a chapter on speed and agility as a co-author to the NSCA high school strength and conditioning manual slated to come out in the spring of 2021. He is married to his wife Mandi and resides in Phoenix Arizona.

Contact: ray@dynamicsportstraining.com

Garrett Kelly, MS, SCCC, RSCC

Garrett is the Director of Strength and Conditioning at DST Arizona / Arizona Christian University. He works with many of our professional athletes in Phoenix as well as student athletes at ACU. Before joining the DST team in January of 2017, Garrett played college ball at Tarleton State University where he garnered All-Conference honors and won Conference Tournament MVP. Upon graduation, Garrett stayed at Tarleton as an intern under Rod Cole. After that, he joined the Strength and Conditioning staff at Houston Baptist University under Rene Peña.

Contact: garrett@dynamicsportstraining.com

Paul Geha

Paul began with working with DST Arizona in 2021 working as a Media Specialist and Content Creator.

DST SAN ANTONIO

Kade Brewer, NFPT-CPT

Kade Brewer serves as the Strength and Conditioning Coordinator and Catching Coordinator at DST San Antonio, overseeing the After School Group. With his background as a collegiate catcher, Kade brings valuable experience and leadership to his role, guiding athletes to enhance their strength, conditioning, and fundamental skills. Kade is dedicated to fostering the growth and development of athletes, empowering them to achieve their full potential both on and off the field.

Contact: kbrewer@dynamicsportstraining.com

DYNAMIC SPORTS THERAPY

Contact: therapy@dynamicsportstraining.com

Dr. Steven Islas, PT, DPT, CSCS

Dr. Islas is our in-house sports physical therapist at DST. He grew up in Big Spring, TX playing multiple sports at the high school level. While living in west Texas, he received his undergraduate degree in kinesiology from The University of Texas Permian Basin (UTPB). Steven completed a Doctorate in Physical Therapy from Texas Woman’s University – Houston in 2018. He is passionate about helping athletes return to throwing, running, and sport performance.

Contact: steven@dynamicsportstraining.com

Casey Meyer, MS, ATC, LAT

Casey has been with DST since 2021. He is a Board Certified Athletic Trainer, Certified Strength & Conditioning Specialist, Corrective Exercise Specialist and is TPI Certified. Previous to working with DST, Casey spent time at Texas State, TCU and most recently served as the Head Athletic Trainer for Texas A&M Baseball.
